title._content: [Portrait of Johnny Richards, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Johnny Richards, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: The Gooney Bird gives little comfort, Johnny Richards finds, when the weather's hot and the piano's getting lost under the score paper. Crack arranger Richards finds it difficult to let the gooney do his work for him. Boyd Raeburn, whose band uses the Richards arrangements, ought to get a couple little worry birds of his own. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 274 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Gooney fails a tired friend," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 20 (Sept. 24, 1947), p. 2. Subjects: Richards, Johnny Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Composers--1940-1950. Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P.
